sentence.Network_en: Although I didn't betray a trust, I feel I behaved shabbily.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管我没有辜负别人的托付,却感到自己行为龌龊.

sentence.Network_en: I think you were very shabbily treated.
sentence.Network_cn: 要我说,你真是受大委屈了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 上班女郎_百度百科 ... ⒐impeccable a. 无懈可击的；无缺点的 ⒑shabbily ad. 衣衫褴褛地；不体面地 ⒒terrific a. 糟糕的.
高三英语units1... ... shabbily adv.     be shabbily dressed 衣衫褴褛 I have some things to attend to. 我有些事情要处理。.

list.abs: ...dress respectably穿得体面dress shabbily穿得破旧dress smartly穿得时髦.
a shabbily dressed man ., 一个衣衫褴褛的男人.
He w was treated very shabbily by the press during this period ., 在这期间 , 他受到了新闻界极不公正的对待.
a dirty shabbily clothed urchin ., 衣裳褴褛而又肮脏的顽童.

entry.def: Shabby things or places look old and in bad condition.

example.ex: His clothes were old and shabby...
He walked past her into a tiny, shabby room.
example.tran: 他从她身边经过，走进了一个狭小简陋的房间。

entry.def: A person who is shabby is wearing old, worn clothes.

example.ex: ...a shabby, tall man with dark eyes.
example.tran: 一个黑眼睛、高个子、穿得破破烂烂的男子

entry.tran: (行为)不公正的，卑鄙的，卑劣的,令人无法接受的
entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as shabby, you think they behave in an unfair or unacceptable way.

example.ex: It was hard to say why the man deserved such shabby treatment...
example.tran: 真搞不懂为什么这个人就该受到如此不公正的待遇。

example.ex: I knew it was shabby of me, but I couldn't help feeling slightly disappointed.
example.tran: 我知道我不应该这么想，但我还是不禁觉得有点失望。

means.word_mean: 1. so as to appear worn and threadbare or dilapidated;
2. in a mean and ungenerous manner;

sentences.sentence: "the two were haggling shabbily in the drawing-room"

auth_sentence.content: "They were pretty shabbily dressed," Sir John recalls.
auth_sentence.res_content: "They were pretty shabbily dressed," Sir John recalls.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "They were pretty shabbily dressed," Sir John recalls.

auth_sentence.content: It's somehow comforting to know it wasn't only the BBC that treated its archive so shabbily.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's somehow comforting to know it wasn't only the BBC that treated its archive so shabbily.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's somehow comforting to know it wasn't only the BBC that treated its archive so shabbily.

auth_sentence.content: He was a shabbily dressed man, everything he wore having been abandoned by someone else.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was a shabbily dressed man, everything he wore having been abandoned by someone else.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was a shabbily dressed man, everything he wore having been abandoned by someone else.

sentences.en: I think you were very shabbily treated.
sentences.cn: 要我说，你真是受大委屈了。
